name: gingival
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to or affecting the gums (= the firm tissue in the mouth that covers the bones into which teeth are fixed): gingival tissue Possible sites for biopsy include the minor salivary glands, gingival tissue, and skin. gingival bleeding Some of the dogs experienced gingival bleeding.gingival disease Gingivitis around the teeth is a general term for gingival disease affecting the gums.
More examplesFewer examplesDr Patel says abrasion caused by over-brushing is common and she sees cases of serious tooth and gingival loss.A hypersensitivity reaction to chilli may cause severe gingival inflammation, discomfort, and bleeding. Gingival recession and enamel loss both contribute to the prevalence of dentinal hypersensitivity. This early stage of periodontitis is characterized by inflammation, gingival swelling, and beginning of bone loss.
